IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate you may have been impacted by unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Rectory Lane.

Steps.Message: Good evening, this is a message from Will at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which took place today, the 23rd of January, 2026 in the CT4 postcode area. I am pleased to advise you we have completed all work and restored the power to all 32 affected properties. The power was switched off at 09:51 to enable our engineers, to replace and upgrade a transformer in the Canterbury Road area. Thank you for your patience while this essential work was carried out. We are sorry for the delay in restoring supplies, this was due to some unexpected safety concerns found during their work. Now this has been completed though, this has improved the reliability of the electricity network, ensured it can cope with the increased demand during the winter months and reduced the risk of you having an unplanned power cut. Our reference number for this work was INCD-327187-U. As we always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered that service then please call 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Good afternoon, this is Sam from UK Power Networks, with a quick update regarding the planned works taking place today. I have spoken to the contractors working in your area and I am pleased to say the works are progressing well and at this stage, we are still aiming to have the power back on between 16:00 and 17:00. Our staff working do appreciate it is colder this time of year, and they will do all they can to get the power back on earlier if possible. Rest assured, if anything changes, we will of course let you know. For any more information, please visit our website or call us on 105. Thank you.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 20:46 - We can now confirm that all power in the Imperial Place BR7 5 area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 20:23 - Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers. We know your power may now be back on; however, we'll keep sending text updates until everyone's electricity is restored. To stop SMS updates, visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3. If your power is still affected, our engineers have been in touch to advise that investigations on the network are ongoing. Due to this, we're now estimating that we'll have the remaining power restored by 00:00-01:00. We're very sorry to adjust our time frame, but we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lee at 19:41 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 11:43 - We're pleased to report that all power in the Peasenhall IP17 2 area should now be restored. Our engineers have now safely connected temporary generator, and these will be providing your power while our engineers work to fully repair the unexpected overhead network fault.

Depending on what the issue is, it may take a few days for our engineers to plan in the work and make their repairs, but once this is completed safely the generators can be removed, and network power will be resumed.

If you'd like any further information, or if your power is not restored, please call us any time on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 11:07 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that they are still working to restore power to the final 7 properties . Due to the delay this has caused, they've advised a new time of between 14:30 and 15:30 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Please ignore the previous message as this was sent in error. We are aware that there are still 7 properties affected by the overhead network fault.

Our customer support vehicle is now on site. It's located outside 9 Hackney Rd, Peasenhall IP17 2HS (W3W: ///weddings.reliving.smudges ) and is ready to provide extra support to anyone affected by the power cut. 

If you have someone in your property or know of someone who needs extra care or cannot travel to the vehicle, please let us know by calling 08003163105 or tweet us @UKPowerNetworks. Sent by Kevin at 10:51.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Luke at 09:47 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 240 customers in the Baker Close area, by diverting power around the high voltage fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 09:26 - Our engineers have informed us that they believe the power loss is due to a faulty piece of high voltage equipment.

We're sorry for the disruption this power cut will be causing, especially the impact it will be having on the start to your day. If you have any concerns about this please do not hesitate to contact our Customer Services team any time.

We will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 08:20 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 09:41 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 2157 customers in the Ipswich IP2 8 area, by diverting power around an overhead network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.

Our engineers have been in touch to advise that due to a water leak we have had to stop our repairs for safety. We are working with the utility and will continue our repairs as soon as it is safe for us to do so.

At this stage we're still estimating power will be on between 19:00 and 20:00 though it is likely this will need to be adjusted once the water board have arrived and completed their initial investigations.

We're really sorry for the delay, we'll update you as soon as work recommences. Sent by Will at 18:51.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Logs.Comment:
We have spoken with our engineers on site and they have advised that we are still waiting for the water board to arrive to deal with the water leak. Due to this, at this time we are unable to provide an accurate time frame for when the power will be back on.

As soon as the water board have completed their assessments we hope to know more. Rest assured we will continue to liaise with our staff in the area and as soon as we have any further information, I will let you know.

In the meantime, if you have any questions or concerns, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. Sent by Will at 19:39.

MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV UG Network Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this, but we are sorry we can't give you a time for the restoration of supply at present.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that excavations are slow going due to multiple network cables within the vicinity that they need to work around. They may need to isolated further properties to allow for repairs.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 00:30-01:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Decasta at 19:18.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 14:14 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Oak Street area, the estimated time of 16:30 and 17:30 hasn't changed. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Stuart at 13:55 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 941 customers in the SW20 0 area by diverting power around an underground cable fault.. We're pleased that we have been able to restore power sooner than we estimated.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, Stuart from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers have worked to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the SW20 0 area to investigate the power cut affecting 219 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Stuart at 13:47.

Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

We'll keep you updated.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.
